intro: Centaurea ertugruliana, commonly known as the Ertuğrul's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its vibrant blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stem is erect and branching. It is a relatively small plant, usually reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
